website_summaries.verdict: No more struggling to transport heavy weights. These bags come empty and can be filled with sand, rocks or whatever material is available on-site.
pros: Stabilize any brand of canopy with  universal weight bags
Fill with sand, snow, rocks or whatever material is available
Specially designed lock system ensures the weight bags stay securely attached to canopy legs
Bags weigh 30-35 pounds when filled with sand
Bags measure 10" length x 5" width x 16" height
cons: May only hold around 25 pounds of sand, but that's still a significant amount of stabilization

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality and great price. The bags are quite big and can take a lot of sand to fill depending on how many you have. They have vinyl inserts to prevent sand from coming out, which is great. They also have a lot of straps and string velcro to keep everything tied and on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, 30#/bag with sand
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Sturdy built-in carrying handles, hook-loop closure at tops of the 2-tubes/bag function well. Put 30# sand into each bag (2-cylinders/bag). Placed a garbage bag into cylinder prior to sand to keep the sand dry. Sept-2017; 2-years on and still going strong! Held canopy down even during a thunderstorm which tore the canopy. And now the price is much less...an even bigger bargan.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Worked well to secure our Roof Deck Gazebo...
customer_reviews.text: We needed to secure one of the legs on a gazebo on our common roof deck. Two of these weight bags tied together with some additional velcro did the trick. I filled them up with All Purpose Gravel from our local building store.
customer_reviews.author: GLENN CONRADT

customer_reviews.title: One of these bags developed a hole upon first use
customer_reviews.text: Upon first day of use, one of these weight bags developed a hole underneath the stitching where the strap attaches. Perhaps I attached the strap to tightly, but these are not nearly as durable as they appear or as I would expect. Already tired of dealing with this one busted bag as well as leaking sand, I have ordered more expensive solid weights for next time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Although not shown in the photo, I used these weight bags to secure a canopy cover over my Big Green Egg. So far they are working as advertised. Be careful. Don’t fill the bags too full. They then are hard to wrap around the legs. I put sand in freezer bags first as recommended on a YouTube video.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Product not like pictured. There is no velcro to "fold over" so the sand just falls out when moving them as the velcro at top is not secure enough to stay together. Purchased for a tent for fair, picnics and such and these would not work as is unless I want sand all over my car. Also no logo on the top like in the main pictures. Do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Flower Girl

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to be well made, used twice one bag ripped at the seam
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for holding my canopy down at the Farmers Market. Used them once, went to use them a second time, and sand was every where. Ripped at the seam. There should be a warranty on this kind of thing, but it seems there is not a way to get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Poolboy59

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these Eurmax weight bags for a canopy that we take weekly to a farmer's market. When I examined the bags I was impressed with what seemed to be the thick fabric that they were made of. However, the second time they were used, the bottom of one of the bags ripped completely off when it was picked up. And I can assure you that the bags were handled with care. The bags we had before were cheaper and lasted a full year before we decided to replace them with these Eurmax bags because the seams had become loose. Next time I'll buy the cheaper bags that last and year and don't rip.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent M.

customer_reviews.title: These weight bags are very sturdy, amazing and held the tents down even with ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 sets of these. - 2 for my canopies (10x10 and 12x12) - 1 for my mother in law (13x13) We purchased these right before camp and was nervous that it wouldn't get here in time however we got it just in time. We got the kids to run down to the beach and fill these bags with sand. These weight bags are very sturdy, amazing and held the tents down even with the wind and rain blowing like crazy. I will 100% recommend these bags to anyone who wants to make sure their canopies stay on the ground and in one piece. Thank you! E.Vang
customer_reviews.author: envang

customer_reviews.title: Best Bags of this type on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed. Purchased these and a set of $60 ez bags at the same time. These are so much better than the more expensive bags. They are made out of a much sturdier material, the fold-over closure system doesn't leak sand like the ez bags and they're $20 less! Just bought another set.
customer_reviews.author: WET

customer_reviews.title: will not hold up
customer_reviews.text: 7-20-2019 out at a craft show today small gust of wind came by and bent all 4 legs at the top of the canopy 219.00 down the drain i will never buy euromax anything. the best thing we got out of that were the sand bags for weights
customer_reviews.author: Danny Haussler

customer_reviews.title: extra security for the gazebo
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. we opted out of putting bags inside then putting the sand in and just put the sand directly into the Eurmax bags. So far no leaks. the gazebo seemed to be holding fairly well on its own of course but we live in florida and it gets really windy here so having the extra weight on here helps us know there is that extra security this thing isn't going to blow away. it hasn't shown any signs of budging with the storms we have had so far. the price was fair, the bags were easy to use there really isn't anything to them. simple.
customer_reviews.author: Zorm

customer_reviews.title: They Leak!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I got these to add extra weights to my tent for an event this weekend. I liked the fact of the fold over flap to keep sand from coming out of the top since my current ones do not seal well at the top. I filled up one with sand that I had on hand, picked it up and put it on the rail of my van. Thank goodness I didn’t put it inside my van and noticed 2 small piles of sand. Sure enough there are areas in the seams at the bottom that allow sand to flow out. The reviews are misleading.
customer_reviews.author: N. E. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great sand bag... just needs one tweak
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with the quality of the bags. I filled them up and carried them to the canopy.. then I found that one little tweak that I think they need. The Velcro strap that goes about the pole needs to be about 2-3" longer. I did fill them to just below the Velcro used for sealing them so they were pretty stiff, and I did use them for a car shade which has 1.5" poles.. with that said, the straps barely were long enough. We shall see how they hold up in the wind. I doubt they will be any problem.. but you never know.. I would recommend them for sure.
customer_reviews.author: pythan

customer_reviews.title: Seem well-made but not perfect two carrying straps immediately broke.
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these bags to tie down our 10 x 10 tent for farmers market‘s. The bags seemed well-made and easy to use not hard to fill with two people doing it. After filling we grabbed the top strap to carry them and two of the four and Immediately broke and began to unravel. Not a huge issue but makes caring them and moving them slightly harder. The straps breaking seems a bit odd since the rest of the bag seem well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Really cheap material!!!
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews looked good, but the same day I was filling mine up with sand, the first one busted before I closed it up. I definitely recommend (IF you buy this) use caution as, if you don’t put a plastic bag liner, the sand will go everywhere when the bag busts open. When, not if it busts open. Very cheap material!!!
customer_reviews.author: Erwynn Umali-Behrens

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made Product
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. These work awesome as canopy tent weights but they are poorly made. After just 3 uses, the bottom stitching on one of them has torn open, spilling sand all over.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C. Poole

customer_reviews.title: Double Set
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased these, I thought I would get 4 bags, instead I received 8. There is a taller set & a short set. I chose not to use sand, but instead put steel slugs in the bags.. The bags are extremely durable & after a year still show very little signs of wear & tear
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and effective solution!
customer_reviews.text: These work incredibly well, and much better than I thought they would! We filled these with sand, and wrapped them around the legs of our 10'x10' tent canopy for the August 21, 2017 solar eclipse. We made it into a party, and wanted to have some shade for the brutally hot South Carolina summer days. Despite some 30+ mph gusts, these held like a champ, and we wound up keeping it up for about a week, and we never had a single problem. Can't say enough...inexpensive and effective solution! Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Blum

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beach!
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have if you are using a Canopy at the beach. We have been using a 10x10 canopy for our beach trips and always have issues with the wind. We used to drive stakes into the legs as well as attach ropes to the corners and drive more stakes into the sand to try and prevent the canopy from blowing away. These bags provided a ton of support and prevented the need for all the additional stakes. These will be a requirement for all of my future trips.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: great bags
customer_reviews.text: fits legs of awning perfectly and holds it down.. you MUST use a liner bag if you dont want it to leak. I have been using sandbags with photography and video for years, and always filled ziploc bags inside the sand bags for years of leak free use. With the size and shape of these, use some small office or kitchen trashbags, push down into bag and fill trash bag with sand. youll have to shake and bounce bag as you fill to compact sand into place, tie off trash bag when full, then roll and secure sandbag top. Its a pain but youll only need to do this once for the life of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: VwgnTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: POOR CRAFTSMANSHIP
customer_reviews.text: These are a great idea..... That being said. 1) they are difficult to fill on your own without making a mess 2) the seams are weak so be gentle with them. I was filling one of the tubes with sand when I noticed that I was spilling more sand than I had already been. When I looked closer I realized that about 4 inches of the seam had opened up rendering that tube half useless. We now have to get a replacement on short notice because the event that we need them for is a day away.......ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Amana

customer_reviews.title: Can see daylight through the bottom stitching!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these canopy tent bags, but looking inside I can see daylight through the big 'dog stitches' that are use to sew the bottom to the sides. Not too much hope anymore. But I think a poor solution will be to cut the corner off of heavy plastic contractor bags and contain the sand in these inside of each cylindrical cell. I think that cutting corners with the stitching assembly is poor form. Good luck with yours!
customer_reviews.author: Emile Borne

customer_reviews.title: Quality design and material
customer_reviews.text: Filled four of these with sand to stabilize two 9' porch umbrellas. The design is especially functional, with tabs to move the cylinders about easily, and the material is tough. Heavy-duty velcro fasteners keep sand from leaking and side-straps are long enough to stretch around both umbrella poles and bags themselves. Each of the two cylinders per bag holds about 10 lbs of sand, so two bags is about 40 lbs total per umbrella (order contained four bags).
customer_reviews.author: Shrink Rap

customer_reviews.title: Just the right amount of weight
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for my canopy. We had some sustained winds at 20mph with gusts up to 40mph so i was worried. The event turned out great and because my canopy was weighted down well I had no problems! UPDATE: One year later for the same event i had originally purchased these for, one of the bags tore at the bottom. The seam completely ripped spilling sand everywhere. Of course the warranty was expired by 5 days. Because i only do limited outdoor events, these weights were only used about 5 times in that year of owning. Super disappointed because i really loved them
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently bought a Quictent Canopy tent and bought these bags to go with them. They are HUGE!. It comes with a set of 4 weight. Each weight have 2 slots to fill with sand. I filled mine with pea gravel that I bought at Lowes for 3.88 a bag. I needed 4-5 bags of pea gravel or you can just use sand. These bags are very big but worth it because they really did do the job of holding down my tent in windy weather.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: Within one year these bags have disintegrated. Threadbare, sand falling through.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Fodera

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: i filled them with concrete to make sure of it's sturdiness, maybe perhaps they are not camping tents. Don't buy this if you are looking to use them for camp tents, you can purchase them for gazebo because the legs are much wider or bigger than camp tents. I don't want to return them because it's probably not their fault. I just thought they will work for camp tent.
customer_reviews.author: BECKY UMEH

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought these...
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought these...they were kind of an after thought...we had an event that needed a tent and decided to go ahead and order them for that event instead of using something heavy to put on the four legs. It was extremely windy that day and everyone else's tent had to be taken down but our didn't since we had these attached. So thankful we decided to get them, they definitely came in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great weights! I use them for summer markets, they aren’t bulky but keep the tent weighed down! Easy to fill, we used sand in ours.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as before.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this every weekend for 4 years, two of the old bags finally gave up and split after years of heavy use. Loved them. These "new" ones are not the same heavy canvas type material. They are calling it polyester now I think. Very thin and I dont think they will make it very long.. Worst yet, they do not come with the carry strap! Ridiculous. If I did not need them this weekend, they would go back and I would get another brand. Will use them and return them under the one year warranty, Cause I know these will not last.
customer_reviews.author: Jody H.

customer_reviews.title: Very Robust Weight Bags Carry The Load Without Flinching
customer_reviews.text: Yes, if you are reading this review you want to order these weight bags for your pop up canopy. I am so happy with these. I loaded them with rocks as well as sand and I can tell you the will take whatever you can dish out and stand their ground like loyal sentry dogs. I am sorry I did not get them sooner. The Velcro is substantial and there are plenty of purchase points for your tie lines so you have lots of configurations to choose from. I am going to get a super large pop up and will buy these bags for the additional legs. Don't hesitate just do it. Order now
customer_reviews.author: CS Castellana

customer_reviews.title: New buyer, just added sand, seem like an awesome product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I received the bags quickly which is always great. I loaded them up with sand about a day later. I have a big 10 x 20 tent that I put up in the back yard and only had 3 sand bags. The bags seem hight quality and durable but time will tell as they are now outside and doing the job. They were out overnight when it snowed in Chicago in late March. I do wish they were a big bigger (taller) and held more sand. It also seems like the bags "fall off" the legs but that could be either user error or it was quite windy.
customer_reviews.author: ncaa118

customer_reviews.title: Not 30-35 lbs
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised as "Each bag weight capacity is about 30-35 LBS" which cannot be true. I bought two 50lb bags of sand. Only 1.5 of the bags fit. So, only about 75lbs of sand fit into the 4 sandbags I purchased. Rather than 120-150lbs of weight on the legs, I have around 75lbs. This seems like a significant difference. The bags are secured by Velcro on the top, which is not very strong but does the job. The rest of the bag seems well made, just smaller than advertised which is very disappointing because the bag does wrap tightly around the canopy tent legs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael wadleigh

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality, but cheap
customer_reviews.text: This package included 4 sand bags total, but 1 of them split at a side seam when filled with end and the other had only the fuzzy strip of Velcro and no hook strip, so the top wouldn’t close (bad manufacturing quality check). Overall, the bags function as described, just the quality isn’t great. We use these bags to add weight to the base of a cantilever sunbrella. When it rains, the bags get soaked, which isn’t a problem in itself, but it takes a while for the sand inside to dry, so if you need to move the bags while the sand is wet, water runs out of the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Fader

customer_reviews.title: Survived Hurricane Isaias!
customer_reviews.text: We got hit with Hurricane/tropical storm Isaias yesterday and I was petrified to lose my newly purchased gazebo. I lifted off the canopy sides to let air get through and these weighted bags filled with sand did their job!!! 70mph winds and the base did not budge!!! I was so impressed I had to come on a day later to leave a great review!
customer_reviews.author: Christen

customer_reviews.title: Worked through an entire season ... that's a step above the competition.
customer_reviews.text: These held up through a full season (summer) of art shows. So they're a step ahead of all the others out there. Good quality if not a bit on the small size. Still have a few I haven't used yet, but the ones that I have are still going great.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Must get for beach!
customer_reviews.text: These were awesome on the beach for our canopy! We felt confident with our tent using just these on the windy beaches of NC and Massachusetts We used the kids sand pails to quickly fill them up and strap them to the legs. The Velcro is very durable and provided a great hold. Easy to dump and fold, barely took up and room which may be my favorite part when lugging all of our beach gear!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer VanBuren

customer_reviews.title: Great product, quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use with my ARB awning on my truck so I wouldn’t have to stake it out with guy lines, etc, in the wind. These are VERY sturdy and durable. I filled with sand and wrapped them around - so very happy with the setup. Now kids, dogs, people, wind won’t knock over the awning. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: LRC5555

customer_reviews.title: Super Useful Sandbags
customer_reviews.text: We got these for sandbags around the base of the free standing umbrella near my pool. It happens to be storming today and the haven't moved and are working out great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mtas1025

customer_reviews.title: READ this before filling!
customer_reviews.text: An extra line of protection for my pop up awning on windy days at the campgrounds. They arrive empty. You fill them with clean sand yourself. Don’t use sand from any beach as it will get stinky! Buy a bag of new, clean sand from your big box hardware store so you won’t mind keeping them full & storing them in your camper or garage. Sometimes the tethers from a pop up just aren’t enough. Better to be safe & protect that investment.
customer_reviews.author: McSusie

customer_reviews.title: 10 Stars
customer_reviews.text: We have had some wicked thunderstorms roll through this year. Before we purchased these the storms sent our gazebo flying. Just had a storm come through that was as bad if not worse then then the one that lifted the gazebo & it didn’t budge with these on. I recommend them to anyone & everyone who has a gazebo these will keep it in place without a doubt
customer_reviews.author: Top Wrench

customer_reviews.title: Good bags for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice thick material will last a long time. Opening has velcro not a zipper that will get stuck over time if you choose like I did to change its contents from sand to rocks because the sand was coming out of the bags through the stitching all over my car when I took them in and out of my car each fair I did.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great value great product !
customer_reviews.text: Bought 8 of these for two Canopys for camping. Took them to Colorado on all kids of nasty weather. They are easy to fill and they are very heavy once filled. The only thing that would improve these is a second Velcro strap , when you put them on the legs they sag down from the weight and there is only one strap so if it had another you could secure it better to the poles. But even in very high winds and rain in the Rocky Mountain National Forrest they did the job. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissytoyou

customer_reviews.title: I had to buy these for a craft show that ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy these for a craft show that insisted we have 40 lbs on each leg of our tent. I filled them as full as I could with sand and they were still only about 27lbs. Another crafter had the same bags and he filled them with rocks and said that made them 40 lbs. The ones I received are very well made and durable so I think they are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made. Get a plastic bag to line it for the sand since it's not waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set I have bought for my canopy. I'm an artist and I do a lot of outside arts and crafts shows, often on concrete. These weights are sturdy and easy to attach to my tent's legs. I put plastic bags in these bags to have a lining for the sand to keep it dry in wet weather conditions. I got about 30lbs per bag out of it, which is just enough for me to carry comfortably. I needed another 4pack because most shows require around 60lbs per leg.
customer_reviews.author: Discombobi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: I filled them with sand and was shocked by the quality for the price. I’ve thrown these things etc and none of them have popped open which is shocking for Velcro
customer_reviews.author: Juci Luci lu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these weights to stabilize a pop up tent that I was using for a Spring Fun Festival in April. I wanted to make sure it would not move in the wind. While they are a little difficult to fill with sand by yourself, with a little help from my husband I had them filled in about 5 minutes. I purchased a $6 bag of sand from Home Depot and used about half of it to fill all 4 weights. They absolutely held the tent down and they will be great for when we take the tent to the beach!
customer_reviews.author: dmdiet

customer_reviews.title: Security for windy days vending outside
customer_reviews.text: They do exactly what they need to - we filled gallon ziplocks with sand first, as others have suggested, and put them in these bags. On a very windy day, set up on a street instead of the ground, they held the tent fast. (This is an extra set - we got four with the original canopy we bought separately). If you are vending outside, spend the extra money for more bags - it looks more professional that they all match, and they provide security.
customer_reviews.author: Cyntheea

customer_reviews.title: These are the best!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. If you're using a pop up tent for flea markets or craft shows, these weight bags are your best friend. We filled them with sand and brought them with us to our last craft show, we were relieved when powerful September winds left our tent intact while others practically blew away. Everyone kept asking, 'what are those?' 'where did you get them?'. I'm an extremely satisfied customer and would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy at all!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly the sand leaks. Not even two months and two of them have huge holes. Will post pictures soon. Currently having to vaccum my car due to sand being everywhere. Note to self and hopefully others only order the ones that have a zipper
customer_reviews.author: me myself and I

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had a photo to share the amazing job and appearance of the bags
customer_reviews.text: Loved the bags, they were much more attractive and easy to use then sandbags I was previously using. I am ordering the water/sandbags with my next order. Sadly I only had the pleasure of enjoying my bags for a couple of days, they were so good in the wind they were stolen right off the tent. The thieves left the tents (from a previous purchase) they only took the new Eurmax weight bags and new travel bag a birthday gift. I hope they enjoy them as much as I will miss them
customer_reviews.author: P. Lanman

customer_reviews.title: HELL YEAH!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the first weight bags I've used and I am not disappointed at all!! They have held down my canopy without a problem! And I've had gust blow up to 40mph up in the hills where I live, so that alone already won me over. I've only had to put down my canopy to ensure the wind doesn't tear the fabric from the top. Aside from that, the weighted bags have kept it down for months and the material of the bags are still in great condition! Real value for your money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same brand I bought 6 years ago that I had to pass on to someone in need!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great, had some purchased 6 years back, and someone next to us kn the beach was in need, and I was without my ez up, I left them buy the bags for what they cost me, and they were able to keep their canopy from blowing away (for a second time)
customer_reviews.author: K. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We had 2 of our canopies out by the lake and lost both to the wind. I was fortunate enough to be able to put one back together using parts from the other. Ordered these bags, filled each just half with sand. Seems sturdy enough. Can't tell at this point if the seams will hold but so far so good. Used them this past week and had several good gusts and the canopies didn't budge so we are very happy at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great for hard surfaces
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our fundraising canopy. We had some close calls with our canopy lifting up in medium winds will doing fundraisers on a black top or cement surface. Purchased these because of it and it was one of the best purchases. They are easy to fill with sand and simple to wrap around the posts. Took the worry out of the canopy flipping over onto the public while fundraising. Will probably use these over stakes in the future when in grass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and effective but had some rot by end of season
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new set for this year. Last year I used sand and when the bags got wet, it was hard to get them dry. I ended up with some rot by the end of my craft fair season. This year we are using pea gravel, which I think will work better.
customer_reviews.author: catcity

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have a large walk-through Halloween display and have to set up pop-up awnings in my driveway. We used to try and tie ropes to cinderblocks to keep them in place since there is no way to stake them. These worked perfectly, look nice, weren't a tripping hazard, easy to move and store, and even in some nasty, windy weather, our awnings stayed put! Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Dody L. Marriott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for canopy’s and umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my wife to use on her umbrella during baseball games...perfect. I’ve also use it on easy up canopy at baseball complexes Witt no grass to stake it down. You can leave them empty then fill up with dirt or Rocks at the field
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A great value
customer_reviews.text: Use these to keep my pop-up canopy from flying away. This is the second set of these that we have purchased as my husband uses a set to keep his clam shelter from blowing away. Overall I have no issues with them and they are very well made.
customer_reviews.author: MNL

customer_reviews.title: Versatile for use on wake boat
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for large canopy but was not using them as I've not used canopy in a bit. Filled them with gravel and put them in bow of my MasterCrart for wakesurfing to add some weight up front to help with elongating the wake. Added 100lbs doing it!
customer_reviews.author: mgbrew

customer_reviews.title: Great well made product.
customer_reviews.text: These bag are fantastic! They work great for our "pop up" tent. I filled them with gravel ...NOT Sand..why...because the gravel will not sift or leak out the top which is closed with velcro. Thes bags are very well constructed and easy to use. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Win A

customer_reviews.title: Works for my patio table during windy weather.
customer_reviews.text: Appears we’ll made and I expect it will work for holding my patio table down. Two 40# bags of pea gravel fit easily in the four bags so that’s 20# each.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F.

customer_reviews.title: 25% Defective. Overall, working well @24hours and 20+/- mph winds.
customer_reviews.text: One of the four bags received was Defective. The bag failed at the seam while filling the second side. The two bags I did successfully fill seem of good quality, and are doing the job very well in upwards of 20mph winds in the backyard! I feel it's a simple defective bag, and does not reflect the overall product quality! I'll follow-up at a later date to see if they live up to this 5 star rating. 24 hours in, doing well!
customer_reviews.author: Russell Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We used these to hold down our “temporary” gazebo (it stays up all year lol). We live in Hawaii and experience VERY strong winds during hurricane season, but the wind was no match for these babies. We filled them using sand and have had no trouble with them.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: No sand falling through any seams.
customer_reviews.text: They are brand new but so far they were easy to fill, nice and heavy and no loss of sand. I will update because we live in a very windy area and hope these hold our pergola down! Five months later...went to check on them before a storm and found cover has start to disintegrate and one had split completely open, losing all the sand. Uggg.
customer_reviews.author: donutluna

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the product to buy. Used these for a craft show this past weekend and my tent stayed beautifully in the wind! Highly recommend. Used sand from my kids' sandbox to fill the bags. Sure they leaked a small bit out the top....but I just transported in a plastic tub and dumped the sand back in the sand box when I returned home. Awesome price for a great product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to hold down a temporary canopy and these were perfect. They just need to be filled with sand. The only tricky thing was knowing when to stop pouring the sand. Because it is long and narrow, you don't really see it filling up until you are at the top! but it is easy to seal, easy to use and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: aroowee

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set I've bought. The first set I used on an almost daily basis for almost 2 years. I only bought the second set because a hole tore in just one of them. I would say $17 and change for almost 2 years of use is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dormouse

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased January of 2018 while on sale. So far so good, I’ve used for one event and only needed to fill the bags half way with sand. I was required to weigh down a tent without stakes at a recent festival, so I was happy to use these finally. They did great and even weathered a 10 minute storm. They will definitely be heavy fully loaded so watch out. I just used play sand from Walmart to fill them. Will update if anything happens at future events.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: They held my grill cover down During the last hurricane they’re wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Weighted bags keep my tent grounded!
customer_reviews.text: Well-made and functional. Easy to fill with sand and wrap around my tent poles. I used two 50 pound bags of sand to fill all 4 bags. Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Stability in the gusty beach winds!
customer_reviews.text: Wow these sand bags were an awesome addition to make our family beach vacation easier. The grandkids had the chore each day at the beach of filling the bags and then emptying at the end of the day. We used them to hold down our canopy. They did the job well in the windy beach breeze! So glad to have purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Holton

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: OMG! These so rock! It's very windy in the Spring in Denver so pop up tent are 'use with extreme caution' kinds of things. I own a food cart and need the shade a pop up provides. I did have a close call with a gust of wind that wanted to take the tent to Kansas. So I took a chance and got these. Filled half with pea gravel and half with sand. Keeps the tent in place even with the wind! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: imagesinthewind

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This came just in time for our annual 4th of July camp. As the beaches here in Hawaii get windy, this held down out 10x10 pop up tent perfectly. Easy to use, as long as you have some common sense and logic.
customer_reviews.author: chris maxson

customer_reviews.title: Good luck wind.  I have Eurmax Weight Bags!
customer_reviews.text: We had a quick moving storm (about 30 mins) and I spent most of it in the wind and rain holding onto our new patio canopy. Bought these the next day. I spent an additional $10 on 3 bags of sand at Lowes. The next big wind ... that canopy wasn't going anywhere. Directions for use that are included are not very clear. I just filled the two big pockets with sand and used the Velcro straps to secure them to the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M.

customer_reviews.title: Kept my gazebo from flying away ! 👍
customer_reviews.text: These weight bags saved my gazebo from flying away ! One day I came home from work to find my gazebo had moved 8 ft away from where I had it ! The wind was ridiculously strong and if it wasn’t for the bags that gazebo would have flown away ! I would definitely recommend these bags !
customer_reviews.author: Fabian

customer_reviews.title: Easy, convenient, durable, bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Durable, attractive, each bag holds more than enough sand to keep legs on the ground. Easy to wrap around legs and velcro. The last event I did, I watched other tents get blown off the ground from the wind. Mine stayed right in place due to these weight bags. 5 stars all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Robin S

customer_reviews.title: Not useable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product way before I needed it and when I decided to open it up to test setting it up, I noticed one of the legs wouldn’t pull out. On that same leg, the silver locking button was missing. So now, I’m out money and can’t get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S.

customer_reviews.title: Better Products Available At This Price
customer_reviews.text: Product was constructed reasonably well, but the top closure is a single layer of velcro. Compare this to the double zippered closure on ABCCanopy version of essentially the same product, with double zippered top closures, and this item falls short. Meets the basic requirements, but should be cheaper in comparison to the ABCCanopy product, but it is exactly the same price. I wish I had waited....
customer_reviews.author: Photontheeph

customer_reviews.title: Strong canopy weights
customer_reviews.text: This canopy bags are very sturdy with sand. You will need two small bags sold from your local hardware store. Canopy has been used with winds of 20MPH and has held up very good with this set up. Stitching is good quality; no sand leak. This is my second set ; first set lasted 1 year and still in working conditions (started to leak sand but in small amount). I use canopy frequently , and this weights are a must.
customer_reviews.author: Octavio Bocanegra

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: These bags are made of durable material that have lasted through tough use. I love that they are so easy to fill and use, and empty and refill if I wanted. This product is great and Euromax Direct is easy to work with if you have any issues. I not only recommend this product, I have bought several sets for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Work Well... for a 4 sided cross base umbrella.
customer_reviews.text: These weight bags are of nice quality. They hold enough sand to keep an umbrella steady in a soft/moderate wind. For larger umbrellas or offsets, you will want a larger solution. Easy to use, simply unzip pocket and fill with sand, zip back up and hang over the foot. They come with tie downs that wrap around the base footing and can secure them together or to the post if needed so they don't fall off.
customer_reviews.author: David Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A simple solution for a simple job
customer_reviews.text: These work fine with sand. I did not have any of the problems cited by a small percentage of other users who reported leaking, etc. Filled them with sand, secured them to the canopy and it hasn't blown away after three months with more than a few very windy storms.
customer_reviews.author: FeelingOld

customer_reviews.title: My canopy didn't blow away.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a case of bottled water and put that inside, so that way when my event was over I didn't have to store the water (just drank it). My canopy didn't blow away so I guess they work.
customer_reviews.author: s0nicfreak

customer_reviews.title: High winds and canopy didn’t budge!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of these to wrap around the large square legs of my yard canopy, so far so good, we live in a high wind area and these have done the trick. As others have suggested I first placed a big in the pouch then added the sand, worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Mamajama

customer_reviews.title: 💗GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: 💗 We are very happy with our product! They seem to be working great to hold down our gazebo. We have had some heavy winds with no problems😀Anther great product and price from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Sally

customer_reviews.title: Bought for camping
customer_reviews.text: This worked like a charm. We took them camping. I filled them with sand before our trip since I didn't know what was going to be available @ the camp site. These fit around the canopy legs real well. A clean look instead of tying blocks or rocks or stakes down. My brother in law was jealous.
customer_reviews.author: Bigg Dogg

customer_reviews.title: Weights work great!
customer_reviews.text: These weights worked great for what we needed them for. It did take me quite a while to fill the bags with sand. That's no fault of the bag, I probably just didn't have the best tools on hand to fill them efficiently. They appear to be great quality, I suspect they will last us a very long time. When full they are significantly heavy, our canopy isn't going anywhere with these attached!
customer_reviews.author: PastorB

customer_reviews.title: RIPPED OPEN 1ST TIME USED
customer_reviews.text: First time using and 1 has already split at the handle area and spilled sand all over. this is where you are supposed to lift the filled bags, going to duct tape it but really not happy with my first time using
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like using this as it's a great alternative on holding down my shelter when the wind begins to blow. Used to use cinderblocks which were cumbersome, rough, and easy to trip over. I would reccomend this to anyone that uses the shelter for tailgating as we do.
customer_reviews.author: John G Baylis

customer_reviews.title: Eurmax canopy weights
customer_reviews.text: I will be using these weighted sand bags for my Euromax canopy tomorrow. I filled them today and used approximately 50 pounds of sand for 2 bags. The bags are very well made, very sturdy, lined inside. You fold the top over and attach it to Velcro. You may have to watch how you carry them, not sure yet how sturdy the closure will be once closed. The bad attaches easily to the canopy legs with a Velcro strap. I would recommend these sand bags to anyone using a canopy for Art fairs, festivals, etc. I will send a review on the eurmax table and canopy soon after an upcoming art fair I will be attending.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Construction
customer_reviews.text: Construction of these sandbags is top notch. The Velcro strap is wide sturdy. The bags are lined inside to prevent water leaking in. I will use them this weekend at a PSU tailgate so I may have more data but I don’t expect any issues. The only thing I didn’t like was the lack of an internal bag to prevent sand leaking out of the top Velcro closure. I added my own and the look great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: looks sturdy
customer_reviews.text: havent used it yet stiching looks good. no lose threading, my only complaint is the velcro strap it dosent, close with the velcro! i would have to twist strap and tuck under if that makes any sense. update later when i put it to use...
customer_reviews.author: roose

customer_reviews.title: Weighted bags worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Weighted bags worked well. Took almost two full bags of play sand to film them up. Had to get creative on getting the sand into the bags. Openings at the tol are not large enough to pour the sand in directly from the bag. Had to create a large funnel out of cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wright

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the craft show
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I used your product. I was very happy with how everything worked. I set up myself (easy for me to do) as well as taking down. I left the canopy on the frame and it fit in the storage bag! Hallelujah, one less step! One of my sand bags tore at the handle right away. I call and they sent me a complete set at no charge. I am VERY happy with this company and would recommend them to anyone needing a canopy.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill.
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised, just fill and its great. What more can you say, on the beach or in my backyard it hold the pop up canopy with ease. It opens pretty wide to put sand in using a kids shovel, and cleans up rather quickly, best of all it comes in its own bag to store away with the canopy.
customer_reviews.author: mark catalano

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Opted to use pea gravel rather than sand it was much easier to fill. Cut off the end of a solo cup and use that as a funnel to pour to gravel or sand in.
customer_reviews.author: ComeToOrderVA

customer_reviews.title: Must have for easy ups
customer_reviews.text: Great bags for using to weigh down easy ups. I filled up liter bottles with sand to weigh it down. I’m thinking about pouring cement in the bottle instead to give it more weight.
customer_reviews.author: TankJeep2015

customer_reviews.title: Great product for stability
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help keep some furniture stable during our winds. So far so good. They fill up nicely with sand and they Velcro straps are pretty strong.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

product_meta.title: Eurmax Weight Bags for Pop up Canopy Outdoor Shelter,Instant shelter Leg Canopy Weights, Sand Bags, Set of 4
feature_bullets: Set of 4 weight bags. Stabilize any Instant Canopy, Pop Up canopy or folding gazebo structures with a set of durable universal weight bags
Eurmax universal weight bags can be filled with Sand, Rocks, Snow or any available material near by
Specially designed lock system will ensure the weight bags stay securely attached to your Instant Canopy legs
HEAVY DUTY MATERIAL: The weight bags are made of durable backed polyester. Easy to put up and release. Each bag weight capacity is about 30-35 LBS when fully filled with Sand
Note:SAND NOT INCLUDED WHY BUY FROM US:one year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,686 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
